data.title: Impossible to disconnect from nodemon seassion
data.body:
Related to #3238
- Start a nodemon session outside of vscode
- Attach to nodemon form vscode
- Pressing the stop button does not disconnect the debug session, it just reconnects

data.title: Close other files does not close diff editor, md previews
data.body:
Related to #3235
- Have a diff editor open
- Have another file open in a side by side editor
- Close other files does not close the diff editor

Same if you have markdown preview instead of the diff editor

data.title: on mac osx i can‘t update
[folding] Fold action does not respect current folding block
data.body:
Testing #2994

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13283270/3de70c92-daed-11e5-84dd-766846602e2a.gif)

When my cursor is at line `266` and run the Fold action, the folding block that starts at line `263` gets folded. I expected that the block that starts at line `265` to be folded instead.

When the cursor is at line `265`, behaviour is as expected, by the way.

data.title: Nls: align `config` and `loadMessageBundle` calls
data.body:
Testing #3156

When using `vscode-nls`, I have to call `nls.config()` in one file and `loadMessageBundle` in all the others. Couldn't we align this such that I don't need to track whether I have called `nls.config()` in one of my files at all?

Eg: just calling `nls.config()` in all files would fix it for me.

data.title: Screen cheese with suggest widget
data.body: related to #3237 - Type 'aaa' and trigger suggest widget -> you should get no suggestions - Type another 'a' -> you get screen cheese

data.title: Suggest widget: Deleting characters sometimes does not highlight matches
data.body: Related to #3237 - Open any ts file - type 'aa' get suggest widget (first picture), type another 'a' and then delete it (second picture) - notice that 'a' are not highlighted in the second picture

treat some regexp as a comment start
data.body: In jsx, expression like /^\/*$/ is treated as a comment start

data.title: Line selection should always include the line under the mouse cursor
data.body:
As discussed, line selection via <kbd>triple click</kbd> or click & dragging the line number gutter should always include the line directly under the mouse cursor.

Currently it only includes the line before the mouse cursor.

data.title: `Reapply all breakpoints` seems like a bug exposed to the user

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #2832 

`Reapply all breakpoints` -- I haven't seen such an action in other debuggers. IMHO it is the debugger's job to apply my breakpoints, and exposing an action to reapply all breakpoints seems like a workaround for a bug inside the debugger.

data.title: Git checkout should also show remote branches
data.body:
When I press F1 and type Git Chechout [SPACE], I see that I can checkout each tag version of my project, but I don't have any branch appearing in the list!

When I git checkout manually by branch with a command tool, it's working well.
Then, when I go back to vscode, I can work well with by branch.

I would be nice to have the branchs in the list

data.title: [folding] icon hides git gutter colouring
data.body:
v0.10.10-alpha
Css styling for the folding icon over writes that of gitt diff highlighting in the line numbers gutter.

Please see the example below
Note: The if statement is the first line of indentation based folding and has also been edited

I believe the simplest solution is to remove the border-left property from the .folding class, I have toggled this both on dirty and clean lines and there does not appear to be any difference in viewing.

Editor gutter:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/817264/13277888/66960312-dacc-11e5-9b68-82e8dfd44dd4.png)

Git Diff view gutter:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/817264/13277892/7197930c-dacc-11e5-9118-ec4c07c5d5e2.png)

Developer tools css panel:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/817264/13277922/942a2c0e-dacc-11e5-9f41-8385b572c1d9.png)

data.title: When writing a custom debug adapter, variables won't clear on the test client.
data.body: I've been writing a custom debug adapter for vscode and have been running into the following issue: When deploying your extension in server mode ( at least I haven't tested on extension host mode ), and the you drop stop the client abruptly, for any reason, whilst the front-end is still awaiting a request that affects the variables debug view, then even after the client has stopped, whatever values were in the view remain there and become locked. Starting a new debug session does not clear them, you have to open a new window with the project in order for them to clear. These screenshots illustrate : > While debugging on the client, at the same time I have the adapter project being debugger on server mode, and paused while there is still a scopesRequest or variablesRequest response unfulfilled. > > > I've stopped the server without completing the request. The client's variables view remains locked with whatever was last in it. > It's happened both in the January and insider's build.

data.title: Make the quick open prefixes configurable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
on testing #2791:

I tried hard to use the dash ('–') for Working file QP but then realised that the trigger character is in fact a tilde ('~'). We should either use a font that has a better tilde character, or use a better character (who knows how to enter a tilde on a German keyboard?).

![2016-02-23 23-46-40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/13269519/692fbd32-da88-11e5-9d92-7e3c0d8a1ee1.png)

Since we are running out of usable characters, IMO we will have to find a better mechanism for QP.

data.title: Keyboard accessibility: Cannot check breakpoint checkboxes when selecting the line item
data.body:
#3246

The debug panel focus goes first to the list, allowing selection of either "All Exceptions" or "Uncaught Exceptions", tabbing again will focus the All Exceptions checkbox, tabbing again will focus the Uncaught Exceptions checkbox. Focusing the list items seems to do nothing, I expect one of these to happen:
- The list items cannot be focuses/highlighted as toggling is done by focusing the checkboxes.
- You need to focus the list item and hit <kbd>enter</kbd> to toggle the checkbox.
